meanings.definition: A place where waste is discarded.
meanings.sent1: The garbage truck took the trash to the dump.
meanings.sent2: We visited the local dump to recycle our old electronics.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon thought the dump was a treasure trove of goodies.
meanings.sent4: The dump was a mountain of discarded items, towering over the town.
meanings.sent5: The smell at the dump was unbearable, lingering in the air for miles.

meanings.definition: To drop or let fall in a mass.
meanings.sent1: I had to dump the sand out of my shoes after the beach.
meanings.sent2: She decided to dump all her toys on the floor to find her favorite one.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter managed to dump the entire tray of drinks on the customer.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt heavy as if someone had dumped a load of bricks on it.
meanings.sent5: The rain started to dump down, soaking everyone caught outside.

meanings.sent1: The workers had to dump the shipment of boxes quickly to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: He needed to dump all the old files from his computer to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to dump all his clothes out the window if he didn't clean up.
meanings.sent4: The students rushed to dump their backpacks in the lockers before the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to dump its contents into the sea, creating a beautiful blend of colors.
